wikipedia_page.main: Archibald Forbes Devine (2 April 1886 – 30 September 1964) was a Scottish international footballer.

response: Gildea played at centre half for Lochgelly St Patrick's. After he "performed fairly well" as a triallist in a Scottish Union match in February 1909, he signed for Falkirk, and was retained for the following season. Mainly a reserve player, he came into the league side only once, on 29 January 1910 at home to Heart of Midlothian, when captain John Anderson was unfit. He was transfer-listed at the end of the season, and in August 1910, he followed team-mate Archie Devine to English First Division club Bradford City.

link_mentions.page: List of Bradford City A.F.C. players (1–49 league appearances)

response: *Archie Devine (1886-1964), Scottish footballer sometimes known as Andrew
